Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD's decision to uphold the RPD's credibility findings was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed forced marriage and abuse as grounds for refugee status
Remedy_Requested: Refugee protection and successful appeal of RPD decision
Court_Ruling: RAD's decision was reasonable; judicial review dismissed
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to RAD's review
Procedural_Issue: RAD's obligation to conduct independent analysis unless credibility is central
Credibility_Assessment: RPD found inconsistencies in applicant's testimony; RAD upheld credibility determination
Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony regarding forced marriage and abuse
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act relating to refugee eligibility and credibility assessment
Application_Basis: Claim of persecution through forced marriage and domestic abuse
Relief_Sought: Granting of refugee status, setting aside of RPD and RAD decisions
Governing_Rule: Deference to RPD on credibility findings when central to decision
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistencies in applicant's account affecting credibility
Outcome: Claim rejected at RPD and RAD levels; judicial review dismissed
Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced marriage and abuse if returned to country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicant sought refugee status based on fear of forced marriage and abuse but faced adverse credibility findings
Evidence_Handling: RAD reviewed evidence but deferred to RPD on credibility
Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act â€“ failure to meet criteria for refugee protection due to credibility issues
Evidence_Assessment: Subjective credibility evaluation based on demeanor and narrative consistency
Decision_Rationale: RAD reasonably deferred to RPD's credibility findings due to centrality of credibility in the claim
Decision_Making_Body: Refugee Protection Division, Refugee Appeal Division, Federal Court (judicial review)
